intro: Calyptranthes chytraculia var. genuina, commonly known as the Hawaiian calyptranthes, is a flowering plant native to the island of Kauai in Hawaii. It belongs to the family Theaceae and is characterized by its small, evergreen leaves and clusters of white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. It has small, elongated fruits that contain minute seeds. Due to its restricted habitat and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
